intro: Amsinckia ramosissima, commonly known as the desert sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers and hairy, branching stems. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Amsinckia ramosissima is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
